definition: to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)

sentences.english: To cultivate Dao you need to change yourself first and not to make any prejudgments .
sentences.chinese: 修道就是先改变自己，而且不要先入为主。

sentences.english: The hermeneutical method was intended to secure a right understanding of the text from preconceived understandings or misunderstandings.
sentences.chinese: 正确的解释方法就是要避免这些先入为主的误解。

sentences.english: They don’t have predetermined expectations fogging theirjudgment.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有先入为主的期望，那将混淆他们的判断。

sentences.english: that you can't get away from preliminary conceptions about things.
sentences.chinese: 你永远无法摆脱对于事物的先入为主的概念。

sentences.english: Chuang Tzu taught us a similar lesson that we must guard our hearts. Don't have preemptive view.
sentences.chinese: 庄子则要我们也须注意心本身，不要有先入为主之见。

sentences.english: I've already squashed a few of my pre-conceived notions.
sentences.chinese: 我也已经压缩了我一些先入为主的想法。

definition: to be disgusted with/to dislike/bad reaction/antipathy
to get to the heart of the matter
apparently right but actually wrong; specious (idiom)
